awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "Midwestern Workshop in Asymptotic Analysis" that will be held October 4-6, 2019 at Purdue University Fort Wayne. The conference focuses on recent developments in analysis, especially in the areas of applied analysis, approximation theory, potential theory, and complex analysis. 

A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to participate in this conference. This award gives early-career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, and others an opportunity to participate in the conference. The organizing committee will strive to advertise this widely through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at http://mwaa.math.iupui.edu/.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The goal of the Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis (MWAA) is to facilitate interactions and to foster collaboration between mathematicians from the midwestern United States working in approximation theory, mathematical physics, potential theory, and complex analysis by bringing them together in an informal way for a two-day workshop. The major objectives include exposing attending graduate students to different areas of analysis, finding early career mathematicians and giving them an opportunity to present their work, and strengthening the partnership and increasing the collaboration between analysts in the Midwest. 

This award was received to support MWAA held on Purdue University Fort Wayne in Oct. 4-6 2019. The event was successful and the results already reported to NSF. Of the $20,000 award, roughly half ($10,127) was used for the Fall 2019 conference. There were 44 participants, including 5 post-doctoral researchers/visiting assistant professors and 14 graduate students. There were 11 speakers, including 3 PhD students, 2 post-doctoral researchers/visiting assistant professors, 1 assistant (untenured) professor, among which there were 3 women, 2 visitors from overseas, and 1 African American. 

A satellite event to achieve the goals was planned for Spring 2020, but due to the Covid pandemic this was postponed and no-cost extensions were filed by the PI. Once the Pandemic was over, the organizers utilized the remaining funds to restart the MWAA series and hold at Purdue University Fort Wayne in Oct. 7-9, 2022. There were 38 participants, including 6 post-doctoral researchers/visiting assistant professors and 14 graduate students. There were 10 speakers, including 5 post-doctoral researchers/visiting assistant professors, 1 teaching professor, and 1 lecturer, among which there were 2 women and 1 visitor from overseas.

The MWAA series was previously at PFW (2014, 2016), Indiana University (2015, 2018) and IUPUI (2017), as well continued by funding from NSF in IUPUI in 2023. Abstracts and slides from the talks and posters from students are available through the Workshop web site, http://mwaa.math.iupui.edu/ 

 


Last Modified: 12/21/2023
Modified by: Peter D Dragnev
